name: Giulietta e Romeo Hotel

reviews.text: What a great hotel. You would expect the name of the hotel to be coming from the fact that Verona is indeed the city where Romeo and Juliet had their fateful relationship and the devastating finale. The hotel is located directly inside the courtyard where Juliet's home was - the terrace where she leans out when Romeo serenades her is right there in front of the hotel.
reviews.title: Romantic, crisp white sheets, perfect sunny-side up - and perfect location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not only is the location fantastic, the ambiance is fluffy romantic (for those that have an inclination to such style) and the rooms have a super clean feel, with a certain warmth glowing from it, and how comforting it is to lie back after a busy day walking around town on crisp, white sheets - and a perfect breakfast the next day which is served in the comfort of your own room.
reviews.title: Cute hotel in really nice City

reviews.text: Verona is a small, quaint town. I figured if I'm going here only once in my life, why don't I stay at the hotel with the name that brings everyone here?
reviews.title: Fab location and wonderful staff!

reviews.text: I must add that the fabric/ quilt shop was quite nice as well - super friendly staff and great service. They will sew in your name/ messages into hand towels, potholders, and other items they have in the shop - great souvenir to take back.
reviews.title: Fantastic breakfast

reviews.text: Hotel was nice, not the best but for the price we paid it was great.
reviews.title: 2 wonderful nights.

reviews.text: Very comfortable and clean rooms, close to the center.
reviews.title: Cozy hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed in this excellently located hotel on a recent weekend break to Verona. The porter greeted us when we arrived and parked our car (we're very glad we opted for this service as there were some very narrow and winding roads and our car isn't the easiest to find spaces for!)
reviews.title: Excellent location, comfortable, clean rooms...

reviews.text: We were checked in to our room very quickly and after parking the car the porter had also dropped the bags up into the room.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in Verona

reviews.text: There was some refurbishment/renovations when we were staying but they were not impacting on us, the only sign I saw of this was mirrors stacked at the end of a hall waiting to be hung.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: The rooms were well appointed with the usual toiletries, towels and (naff) hairdryer. Plenty of wardrobe space, hangars and a small, but secure safe. Each room has a minibar but as this is Verona we had picked up our own wine! The decor was rather dated and not to our taste but very clean and we couldn't complain as we really picked this hotel for the location.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel
Excellent location, price became an issue
reviews.text: Staff gave good help on getting into town and getting our car parked. Room was warm and A/C wasn't available yet. Bathroom was nicely remodelled. When we walked down the stairs after checking in, we heard the receptionist tell a person who just walked in off the street that a double standard with breakfast was 98 euros - we were paying 158 and booked a couple months in advance!!!! When we asked if there was anything they could do - no! This soured us a bit. But, all in all, it turned out to be a good choice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful location steps from the Arena of Verona and Julietta's house. Designer's shops also two blocks away if that is what you like. The staff was helpful and friendly. The hotel was modern with suites that although small were very comfortable. I would love to visit again.
reviews.title: Romantic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the epitome of three-star hotels, located perfectly in the center of Verona.
reviews.title: Excellent stay in central Verona

reviews.text: The hotel has extremely friendly staff, a nice fitness center, clean modern rooms (albeit the standard room we stayed in is small, so if you need a larger room they have superior rooms which would be recommended if this is a concern). The breakfast is well up to standard and the serving staff is very friendly and welcoming as well.
reviews.title: Romantic hotel in one of the most romantic cities in Italy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room had a queen-sized bed without a gap/divider between halves which is nice as well.
reviews.title: This hotel has it all

reviews.text: We really enjoyed our 4 night stay at the hotel, the staff were so friendly & helpful without exception. Breakfast was very good lots of choice & fresh coffee. Good location & a great restaurant next door. Would recommend.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in Verona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm writing this review as I am about to leave the hotel. We enjoyed staying in this hotel. It's conveniently situated in the town centre within walking distance to all the attractions. The rooms are nice and clean and the staff were very friendly and very informative. They recommended a few nice places to eat which we really enjoyed. There is free parking, free wi-fi, plentiful breakfast... definitely recommend it for your next visit to Verona
reviews.title: Great hotel in the centre of Verona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed staying in this hotel. The staff were very professional, polite and helpful.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Staff and Location
Great Location, Cosy Clean Hotel
reviews.text: The location is great - just beside the lovely 'Piazza Bra' in the very centre of Verona.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had booked an ordinary room and when we were offered a superior room with a balcony at a small extra cost we upgraded and were very happy with this choice. The continental breakfast was very good and fresh. Couldn't fault this hotel.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location

description: Hotel Giulietta e Romeo is just 100 metres from the Arena Verona. Rooms come with elegant parquet floors, a minibar, and a satellite LCD TV.Offering free high-speed Wi-Fi, The rooms are air-conditioned in summer. Each one has a private bathroom with shower and hairdryer. Verona Train Station is 1.5 from km from Giulietta e Romeo Hotel. You can reach the hotel by car, and use the private garage on site
